content.description: Work up small hump to massive jug.  Make killer moves through sparse pockets up to diagonal rail.  Crux in my opinion is at pockets, which makes it a bad spot as you could hit the ground if you peel off when you're clipping and have too much slack out (maybe it's just psychological). Just don't miss the pockets.  Pretty much over when you hit the rail.  Route curves right at the top with an easier finish.
content.location: Just right of Dark Justice, start on hump.

content.description: Route starts at Dark Justice than moves from jugs to the right toward Wicked Game.  Continue traversing right and finish on Equilibrium.
Not a popular route as it is relatively short and the start is very tricky and technical (bring a stick clip if that's a problem).  Crimpy moves follow tiny seem up to massive pockets.
content.location: 10 ft right of Equilibrium.  Can't miss the pockets up top.

content.description: Older climb that needs maintenance.  Got some fun boulder moves, but very short.  Lots of hidden holds.
content.location: Just right of the obvious crack on the arete/chimney on the east wall.

content.description: Very short and powerful route, though it's pretty sweet! Crux is basically from the 4th move until after sticking the hold just above the first bolt. After that, it's just fun, easier movement to the chains. May be flooded right underneath during the early summer.
content.protection:
3 bolts, chains w/ biners

Meant to be stick clipped because of the low crux, but can easily be done safely stick clipless with just a crash pad to protect before the first bolt.*
content.location: Second route from the right. Bolts and chains are new and shiny.

content.description: Not sure if there is a crux.  Pump over bulge then follow flake/seam all the way up.  Fun route.
content.location: Start right of Wicked Game on other end of bulge.  Second black streak from right on northeast wall.

content.description: A great route!  Start with hard moves to jugs.  Make tricky moves on small gaston, pockets, and sidepulls up to crux around 5th bolt, with an easier finish to chains.  ENDURANCE ANYONE?
content.location: Follow up distinct black streak just right of Buffy

content.description: Sketchy crimps and pinches to small hump.  Look for small jugs hidden along the top of the hump. Finish on easy stuff.  Short and Sweet
content.location: Starts on a slightly overhung spot just between a small recess/drainage in the rock and left of a small finger size seam.  Finishes on chains in large alcove.

content.description: Buffy is the longest and hardest climb on the Northeast wall.  There are two possible starts which make vary slightly in difficulty.  Crux is definitely near the top where you follow an overhanging rounded arete and bust a mono to get over the bulge.
content.location:
2 possible starts:

The actual route starts right of small and short finger size crack on the northeast wall.  Follows up the rounded arete just right of alcove/drainage.  If you want a slightly easier start then start in the crack unless that's just not your style.

content.description: This route has every kind of hold from crimps, slopers, gastons, to underclings.  Lots of technical moves.  Weird finish.  5.11d?
content.location: Starts just left off slick black overhanging face.
